definitions.definition: (crosswords, often in combination) A word that runs horizontally in the completed puzzle grid or its associated clue.
definitions.example: I solved all of the acrosses, but then got stuck on 3 down.

definitions.definition: From one side to the other.
definitions.example: she helped the blind man across;  the river is half a mile across
If we sail off at noon, when will we be across?
He leaned across for a book.

definitions.definition: To, toward or from the far side of (something that lies between two points of interest).
definitions.example: Fortunately, there was a bridge across the river.

definitions.definition: On the opposite side of (something that lies between two points of interest).
definitions.example: That store is across the street.

definitions.definition: Across from: on the opposite side, relative to something that lies between, from (a point of interest).
From one side to the other within (a space being traversed).
definitions.example: Could you slide that across the table to me, please?

definitions.definition: At or near the far end of (a space).

definitions.example: This poetry speaks across the centuries.
All across the country, voters were communicating their representatives.

definitions.definition: So as to intersect or pass through or over at an angle.
definitions.example: Lay the top stick across the bottom one.

definitions.definition: In possession of full, up-to-date information about; abreast of.
